meanings.def: a large wild animal of the dog family, that lives and hunts in groups
examples: She compared the media to a pack of ravening/ravenous wolves.
A lone wolf howled under the full moon.
Labour groups are often seen as the big bad wolf.
a story of a young boy raised by wolves

meanings.def: to call for help when you do not need it, with the result that when you do need it people do not believe you
to have enough money to avoid going hungry; to stop somebody feeling hungry
a person who prefers to be alone
to leave somebody to be roughly treated or criticized without trying to help or defend them
a person who seems to be friendly or not likely to cause any harm but is really an enemy

idioms.def: to call for help when you do not need it, with the result that when you do need it people do not believe you

idioms.idiom: keep the wolf from the door
idioms.def: to have enough money to avoid going hungry; to stop somebody feeling hungry
a person who prefers to be alone
to leave somebody to be roughly treated or criticized without trying to help or defend them
a person who seems to be friendly or not likely to cause any harm but is really an enemy

related: keep the wolf from the door

meanings.def: to eat food very quickly, especially by putting a lot of it in your mouth at once
